channel.title: Need help!
channel.description: um i tried to get a render, and um...it has white on it... like u kno in paint were u can make it not have a backround, like its just the picture, no backround colors? yea, how do i do that with photoshop cs1? im gettin cs2 tomorrow....but help me

item.title: Need help!
item.dc:creator: @bigmac bigmac
item.description:
@bigmac wrote:

Pull out your magic wand and click all the white/black/grey and hit delete.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help!
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Exps has pretty much given you what you need to do for WHITE backgrounds. For complex background with the magic eraser tool wont do for you, download my video tutorial on Rendering. It is easy to follow and gives you a good technique for premium rendering.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help!
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

go to the eraser tool, and right click the eraser icon and use the magic eraser. Then click on the backround and that should work. Im not too sure on what your problem is, but i think this will solve it. im almost done making you a sig right now ;D

Read full topic
